Articles.Content:
The tail connector has very low drag compared to cockpit/pod. You can have fast plane by putting tail connector on front and cockpit on the back.

Below is my early career juno based plane:

Useful for contracts that requires 20km altitude or gathering science when "flying high". And it accelerate fast, ideal for impatient pilots.

Beware of the inverted pitch/roll control.

2 minutes ago, mister_goo said:

Beware of the inverted pitch/roll control.

I add my own tip, then. most cockpits, the Mk1 pod among them, have the option to invert the control direction, so you don't have to use inverted commands. right click on the pod and look among the settings, i have no idea how it's called in english
